ECSchema.description: The IoTDevice schema defines common base functional classes to be used for IoT sensor devices.

ECEntityClass.description: A func:FunctionalComponentElement that models a functional IoT sensor device Entity which will not be modeled at a finer granularity and does not have 'child' parts.

ECProperty.description: Asset or container tag in the Time Series Service.

ECEntityClass.description: A func:FunctionalType that defines a shared set of properties whose values vary per-type of a DeviceInterface rather than per-instance.

ECRelationshipClass.description: A type-instance relation; one that indicates that the specific DeviceInterface is an instance of the defined DeviceInterfaceType.

ECEntityClass.description: A FunctionalComponentElement to be used as base-class for concrete classes modeling variables, telemetry or time-series points available on a DeviceInterface.

ECProperty.description: Point tag in Time Series Service.

ECEntityClass.description: A func:FunctionalType that defines a shared set of properties whose values vary per-type of DevicePoint rather than per-instance.

ECProperty.description: Defines the type of measurable physical quantity associated with DevicePoint instances of this DevicePointType.

ECRelationshipClass.description: A type-instance relation; one that indicates that the specific DevicePoint is an instance of the defined DevicePointType.
Relates a DeviceInterface to child DevicePoint which represent variables, telemetry or time-series points available on the parent DeviceInterface.
Relates a DeviceInterfaceType to child DevicePointType which represent types of variables, telemetry or time-series points available on the parent DeviceInterfaceType.

ECEntityClass.description: A DevicePoint that captures the availability of a Time-Series data-point instance on the DeviceInterface.
A DevicePoint that captures the availability of a Set-Point or similar parameter on the DeviceInterface.

ECRelationshipClass.description: Relates a MeasurementPoint with the bis:SpatialElement it is meant to observe and capture a Time-Series data-point from.
